column4: UPDATE 1-Elon Musk never sought approval for a single Tesla tweet  U.S. SEC tells judge
column5: March 18 Chief Executive Elon Musk has never sought pre-approval for a single tweet about Tesla Inc since striking a court-approved deal about how to communicate important information about the electric vehicle maker  the top U.S. securities regulator told a judge on Monday.

column4: Elon Musk tweet about Tesla violates settlement agreement  U.S. regulator tells court
column5: March 18 A tweet about Tesla Inc production targets by Elon Musk was "a blatant violation" of a court order to get his written communications pre-approved  U.S. securities regulators told a judge on Monday  doubling down on the government's demand to find the Tesla CEO in contempt of a previous fraud settlement.

column4: Nvidia  Israel's Cognata to partner on self-driving simulations
column5: JERUSALEM Israel-based Cognata  a developer of simulation platforms for self-driving cars  said on Tuesday it was partnering with U.S. chip supplier Nvidia Corp to speed up testing and validation for autonomous driving.

column4: Nvidia  Israel's Cognata to partner on self-driving simulations
column5: JERUSALEM  March 19 Israel-based Cognata  a developer of simulation platforms for self-driving cars  said on Tuesday it was partnering with U.S. chip supplier Nvidia Corp to speed up testing and validation for autonomous driving.

column4: US STOCKS-Futures higher as Fed kicks off policy meeting
column5: March 19 U.S. stock futures rose slightly on Tuesday as investors anticipated a more accommodative policy stance from the U.S. Federal Reserve in a two-day policy meeting this week.

column4: Exclusive: Israel's chip sales to China jump as Intel expands
column5: TEL AVIV Israel's exports of computer chips to China soared last year as Chinese companies bought more semiconductors made at Intel's Kiryat Gat plant.
